Description: Fragment of rim and bowl of North Ionian pottery cup, perhaps lotus bowl; white slip. Interior: reserved band at rim, glazed below with two added red bands lined in white; exterior: maeander square band in handle zone; four bands below, above two broad bands on lower wall and narrow band at bottom of sherd.
Curator's comments: Not from same piece as 1924,1201.874-6; the lip is taller.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.1034)
